required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Rituximab (MabThera) in Combination With Chemotherapy in Participants With CD20-Positive B-Cell Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
clinical_study.official_title: A Non-Interventional, Observational Phase IV Study to Evaluate Safety of Rituximab (Mabthera®) in Combination With Chemotherapy in Patients Treated With CD20+ Β Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia

brief_summary.textblock: This observational study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of rituximab in combination with chemotherapy in first- and second-line treatment of participants with cluster of differentiation 20 (CD20)-positive B-cell chronic lymphocytic leukemia. Data will be collected from eligible participants receiving rituximab according to the Summary of Product Characteristics (SPC) during 6 months of treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs)
primary_outcome.description: An AE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship.

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) Assessed Using Local Standards
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment until disease progression or death, assessed up to 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as the time from enrollment to the first documented progression of disease or death due to any cause. Progressive disease (PD) was defined as at least a 20 percent (%) increase in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions. KaplanMeier estimate was used for analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Disease Progression or Death Assessed Using Local Standards
secondary_outcome.description: PD was defined as at least a 20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response of Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) Assessed Using Local Standards
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with CR or PR as determined by the investigator was reported. CR was defined as disappearance of all target lesions. PR was defined as at least a 30% decrease in the sum of the LD of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum LD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With CR Assessed Using Local Standards
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with CR as determined by the investigator was reported. CR was defined as disappearance of all target lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With PR Assessed Using Local Standards
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with PR as determined by the investigator was reported. PR was defined as at least a 30% decrease in the sum of the LD of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum LD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Progression (TTP) Assessed Using Local Standards
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment until disease progression or death, assessed up to 26 months
secondary_outcome.description: TTP is defined as the time from enrollment to the PD. PD was defined as at least a 20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions. Kaplan-Meier estimate was used for analysis.

arm_group.description: Participants with chronic lymphocytic leukemia treated with rituximab in combination with chemotherapy according to SPC and routine clinical practice will be observed for 24 months.

intervention.description: Rituximab will be administered in combination with chemotherapy according to SPC and routine clinical practice.

study_pop.textblock: Participants with CD20-positive B-cell chronic lymphocytic leukemia eligible for first-line or second-line therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants with CD20-positive B-cell chronic lymphocytic leukemia eligible for first-line or second-line therapy according to the approved SPC
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindications to rituximab therapy according to the approved SPC

General Hospital of Athens Evangelismos; Hematology
Laiko General Hospital of Athens; A Propedeutical Clinic of Internal Medicine

General Hospital of Patras Agios Andreas; Hematology Department

group.title: Rituximab
group.description: Participants with chronic lymphocytic leukemia treated with rituximab in combination with chemotherapy according to Summary of Product Characteristics (SPC) and routine clinical practice were observed for 24 months.

baseline.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all eligible participants.

group.description: Participants with chronic lymphocytic leukemia treated with rituximab in combination with chemotherapy according to Summary of Product Characteristics (SPC) and routine clinical practice were observed for 24 months.

outcome.description: An AE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship.
outcome.population: Safety population included all eligible participants.

measure.description: An AE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship.
measure.population: Safety population included all eligible participants.

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) Assessed Using Local Standards
outcome.description: PFS was defined as the time from enrollment to the first documented progression of disease or death due to any cause. Progressive disease (PD) was defined as at least a 20 percent (%) increase in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions. KaplanMeier estimate was used for analysis.

group.description: Participants with chronic lymphocytic leukemia treated with rituximab in combination with chemotherapy according to Summary of Product Characteristics (SPC) and routine clinical practice were observed for 24 months.

measure.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) Assessed Using Local Standards
measure.description: PFS was defined as the time from enrollment to the first documented progression of disease or death due to any cause. Progressive disease (PD) was defined as at least a 20 percent (%) increase in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions. KaplanMeier estimate was used for analysis.

measurement_list.measurement: Median PFS was not reached at the final follow up due to high number of censored participants.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Disease Progression or Death Assessed Using Local Standards
outcome.description: PD was defined as at least a 20% increase in the sum of the LD of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded since the treatment started or the appearance of one or more new lesions.
outcome.population: ITT population. Here, ‘Number of Participants Analyzed’ = overall number of participants who were evaluable for this outcome. ‘n’ = participants who were evaluable for specified timepoints.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
